intro: Kyrstenia espinosarum, commonly known as the spiny kyrstenia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered leaves, which are typically covered in fine, spiny hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing minute seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species. Its botanical features make it an important subject for ecological and conservation studies.
